page.title: 10WILDLIFE AROUND PLOCKTON.
page.content: THERE ARE TWO DIFFERENT ANIMAL AND PLANT{HABITATS}HERE.THERE IS THE SEACOAST,WITH SMALL ISLANDS AND INTERESTING SEASHORE.INLAND THERE ARE FORESTS,HEATHERY HILLS AND BOGS.IT IS NOT HARD TO SEE{GREY SEALS}AND SOMETIMES{OTTERS}MAY COME INTO THE BAY.{HERRING GULLS,GUILLEMOTS,AND {EIDER DUCKS}ARE COMMON ON THE SEA. {OYSTERCATCHERS,HERONS AND CURLEWS}CAN BE SEEN ROUND THE SHORE.THERE IS A HERONRY ON THE ISLAND AT CRAIG.THERE IS A GREAT VARIETY OF PLANTS AND SEASHORE LIFE.INLAND{DEER}ARE COMMON, {ROE DEER}AT TIMES COMING INTO VILLAGE GARDENS TO FEED.{PINE MARTENS}AND OTHER SMALL MAMMALS ARE FOUND IN THE MAINLY {CONIFEROUS FOREST.BUZZARDS ARE THE COMMONEST BIRD OF PREY AND ARE OFTEN SEEN WHEELING OVERHEAD OR PERCHED ON A TREE.{HOODED CROWS}ARE A NUISANCE,ESPECIALLY TO BREEDING BIRDS.
